title: New Century Schoolbook/Clarendon-ish font?
content:
Hello, was wondering if anybody could ID the font used for some of the display type all over this website. Sorry I can't find a bigger sample--I have a little booklet I picked up but don't have access to a scanner right now. It seems sort of like New Clarendon or New Century Schoolbook or something but off the top of my head the tail on the 'a' looks a little different and it has that weird thingy on top of the 'g.'

Any help would be greatly appreciated!

Here's the URL:

[http://systembolaget.se/AlkoholHalsa](http://web.archive.org/web/20120111122145/http:/systembolaget.se/AlkoholHalsa "http://systembolaget.se/AlkoholHalsa")

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [logga\_systembolaget.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20120111122145/http:/typophile.com/files/logga_systembolaget.gif) | 2.83 KB |
author: ornmnt

comments.content: They've definitely flipped the ear on the g, that's for sure, and it actually looks (to me) like [News 701](http://web.archive.org/web/20120111122145/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/news-701/), slightly squished.

Custom design for Systembolaget (Swedish Alcohol Retail Monopoly) by [Happy Forsman & Bodenfors](http://web.archive.org/web/20120111122145/http:/www.guldagget.se/nomineringsbilaga/2g3hb4gbv8h98hb9g4vj90vf.php?cat=8&id=3217S). The font is Monopol created by Swedish typographer, Carolina Laudon.
It's based on New Century Schoolbook.
Looks like a condensed version on a "century" face. New Century Schoolbook seems accurate, but the face in question is more condensed and lighter?
